title: Just noticed that Garen's new lore says nothing about his relationship with Katarina
body: I'm guessing it's one of those "that's for another time" things, right?

replies.body: It's not core to the character as he is. I can't say any more than that at the moment.

Just curious, do you have any plans in the future to have some more dynamic lore with inter-champion interaction?

I really enjoyed the Bilgewater story, and the Jax/Fiora tease. WW Kinda got one, but not mentioned by name. I think it would be really something to clarify on the *Cough Cough* vaguer relationships In the League.

(Why are Talon and Quinn rivals?)

> Just curious, do you have any plans in the future to have some more dynamic lore with inter-champion interaction?

Oh indeed we do.

(I wouldn't take too much stock in the 'allies' and 'rvials' sections, they're a bit outmoded.)

I just hope that not every champ gets paired with another champ. it kinda makes the world smaller if they did.

Though I'm not a story master, so maybe I'm ignorant on something.

Nope, that won't happen. Not everyone will be paired up at all (Nocturne and <INSERT HORROR HERE> sitting in a tree...>. 

Many of them won't be paired up with Champs, some will be paired up with non-Champ characters. 

Others will die a lonely death, surrounded by nothing but their regret of not asking Rachel out when they had the chance back in high school, facing the last moments of a darkening consciousness, instinctively aware that nothing, nothing can ever make their life matter now, all because of a solitary, fleeting hesitation.

Ermm, where were we?

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

I'm laughing so hard right now. That was ####ing amazing.

Let me guess, it was Mordekaiser who's had that thought many times over.


Am I right? {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}} 

"Why didn't I ask Rachel out?" Mordekaiser thought, as he was brought down again.
He has her picture over his torture rack.
Can confirm.

Speaking of Mordekaiser,wouldn't it actually make sense for him to have children?
I mean he once ruled over a large part of Runeterra,so it wouldn't be surprising if he had a few mistresses(kinda like Azirs harem).
Of course any children he would have would likely end up as his pawns or enemies(and would be either dead or undead at this point),but I think it would be interesting to see someone who had to grow up under Mordes "care".
It's not out of the question.

Objection!
He has a ton of children!

Children of the Grave to be precise!
Anyone who was alive when Mordekaiser was first alive would AFAIK be long dead by the time of the Ruination, and it's doubtful that their remains would follow his.

Yeah,but we are talking about people who likely had acces to necromancy.

Mordes Liches for example are still alive(or well undead) as they were turned into undeads.
And, well, he himself was resurrected repeatedly, but if that was by any means easy then there would be far more remnants of his time around than just himself and the Immortal Bastion.

So basically {{champion:32}}?
Nah, he's much sadder.

Any thoughts on Braum already being married to a jolly woman? I can already picture it: she loves making him meals (because she loves hearing him compliment her great cooking), and can still beat up a troll with a frying pan by herself.

Kinda like a more badass Mrs. Claus (Santa's wife).

sooo... teemo... 

Also an attempt was made to fix mismatched delimiters.
Agreed. 'Canon' pairings should be very rare imo.

I'd be fine with a champ being paired with someone who's not a champ, as that's realistic, but I just don't want everything to be roses and romance. 

Vi x Caitlyn: Perfect (and likely to happen, imo)

Lux x Ez: makes little sense (to me, I know others hate me for feeling that way), and Ez doesn't seem emotionally mature enough to be in a relationship, at least to me.
Yup, agreed.

Which part are you agreeing with? Vi x Cait, Ezreal not being emotionally mature, or both?

I don't really have an opinion on Vi and Cait, but I can think of a certain champion that could pair well with Ezreal in a way that offers room for both of them to grow as characters and actually have him develop some of that emotional maturity.


And no, It's not Taric.
 {{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

I know, I was being really vague. Sorry about that.
{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

Well then, I guess I'll take the non-vague route and address the one that matters to me and leave this definitely-thought-out-and-not-just-shipping-my-own-desires-even-though-it-may-seem-like-it pairing here.

{{champion:81}}x{{champion:245}}
I think thats a cute pair
It would Be an interesting sort of Romeo and Juliet-ish romance (zaun and piltover). And it would be really interesting to see them breach the class barriers of the two cities.
How much will romance, or sexuality in general, play a part in a champion's story?

Personally, and this isn't me talking about specific stories or content, I think it will be as much as you'd expect in any story. If the focus is on those elements, because we think that's important to the character and story, they'lll be there.

For some Champs, it's central: Lucian and Senna, or Jax and his lamp, but for others it will depend on whether it's an important part of the story that makes sense for them and the overall progression of the world.

That's a great approach I think. It's only a detriment to the story to shoehorn things in. 

Although, speaking of which, I found parts of Shyvanna's story a bit hard to swallow; 
>"Occasionally, her _dragonfyre_ activated the _runic echo_ within her (...)". 

Inserting too much "Mystic Babble" takes me out of the story a bit, honestly. Otherwise it was good, that's the one part I'd critique, though.
Good feedback. Thanks!

"depends on whether it's an important part of the story"

thats all i needed to know that the lore is gonna be great! dont pair people up just for the hell of it or sake of looking "cute" !

So do you guys try to leave relationships open ended, or ambiguous, or anything for the sake of community shipping? The only real "really confirmed no two ways about it" relationship League has as far as I'm aware is Ashe and Tryndamere, even with champions and non-champions.

~~As long as Ahri doesn't get an arbitrary canon pairing I'm happy tbh~~

We have done that, yes. And we pay attention to some of the more popular ships, though we can't really plan ahead with them too much in mind. But if there's something we're writing and we're not planning on doing anything with a pair in the near-term, and we know it's something the community talks about, we'll be purposeful in not closing that loop.
All I ask is to not kill off Javanna, and to keep Shyvanna away from Ezreal, and Vayne, and anyone with a dragonslayer skin.
Fair enough.

Although, I think it was a strange decisions to outright kill off the popular Lux/Ezreal ship, especially considering it has ACTUALLY been referenced overtly by Riot themselves for years and years ("An ancient mystery in Runeterra", for example). 

To be clear, I'm talking about her Ezreal-specific taunt:
> "Are we supposed to be... dating... or something? We've never even talked."

Seems like it's meant to overtly kill the ship. Or am I reading too much into it?
Ahri's canon pairing: Anyone she lands her E on.

( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

Well there's a difference between lust and love.
Sure, but it's hard to tell the difference if you're charmed.

{{champion:4}} +{{champion:103}} = "charmed i'm sure"

the one guy that's so aloof and always playing hard to get ahri just cant seem to catch him with her E
In Lux's new voice I guess Ez x Lux is not fact, don't you?

>(I wouldn't take too much stock in the 'allies' and 'rvials' sections, they're a bit outmoded.)

So Kled is no longer Kled's rival?
Kled is always Kled's rival.

Probably. You can't have a relationship be a main defining character trait. 

That's why "token girlfriend" is dumb.
You can, it just depends on the character. Katarina didn't have much to do with Garen becoming who he is right now. However, Lux, and Jarvan were important.

Does that mean that it can still be a thing, it's just that it isn't even remotely important right now so it wasn't relevant to the story? Or does it mean you guys aren't really concerned with who Garen wants to be with, if anybody? 

Either is fine, I'm just wondering since Tahm Kench and Aurleion Sol and Lux's really new VO says stuff about it. So it seems weird to completely remove it. Unless it's one of those cases where lore v game is just totally different?
